title: Grin and bear it! Giant panda cubs can't contain their excitement as they enjoy a frolic in the snow - playing everything from football to a game of hide and seek
title_page: Grin and bear it! Giant panda cubs can't contain their excitement as they enjoy a frolic in the snow - playing everything from football to a game of hide and seek | Daily Mail Online
text:
Freezing winter weather has brought parts of China to a standstill this week, forcing families to lock themselves indoors as temperatures have plummeted to almost -50 degrees Celsius.
But as these delightful snaps prove, not everyone is suffering in the cold.
Fun-loving cubs at the China Conservation and Research Centre for the Giant Panda could not get enough of the snowy conditions when they were allowed out to play earlier today.
The stunning young animals were seen rolling, climbing and swinging as they frolicked in the white stuff in their play pen in Chengdu.
One even picked up a ball - before realising it was hardly the ideal day for a kick-about. It then took to playing hide and seek instead.
The giant panda is an extremely rare species, inhabiting mountain ranges in the Sichuan, Shaanxi and Gansu provinces of China.
With a population of less than 2000, the species is included on the endangered list by the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora and is protected by Chinaâ€™s Wildlife Protective Law as the special-class protected animal.
With these fur coats, it's hardly likely they will fall victim to the cold, that's for sure!
